project.title: Drawn
project.description: Figures drawn with pen and ink take on a life of their own and interact with their creators, appearing to swim on the paper's surface.

project.title: Sheep Market
project.description: TheSheepMarket.com is a collection of 10,000 sheep made by workers on Amazon's Mechanical Turk. Workers were paid 0.02 ($USD) to "draw a sheep facing to the left."

project.title: Flight Patterns
project.description: A visualization of airplane traffic over North America during a 24 hour period in August 2010. The different colors are coded to the 573 different types of airplanes that traveled through North America, totaling over 205,000 flights.

project.title: Meshu
project.description: The idea is to turn locations into objects - the site is a tool for entering in places and creating a unique shape from triangulating those point.

project.title: Processing
project.description: An open-source language and environment for learning the fundamentals of electronic art and computer programming, developed at the MIT Media Lab's Aesthetics and Computation Group.

project.title: Tron (1982)
project.description: One of the earliest feature films to reflect the video-game craze of the 1980s. Stars Jeff Bridges as computer programmer Kevin Flynn, who becomes part of the very game that he's programming

project.title: Eyewriter
project.description: A low-cost eyetracking system originally designed for paralyzed graffiti artist TEMPT1. It uses inexpensive cameras and computer vision enabling a user to draw with eye-movement.

project.title: Lumarca
project.description: A projector throws its beam on an array of vertical wires. The result is a floating, glowing 3d object made entirely of light.

project.title: Lit Tree
project.description: The leaves of a tree are used as the voxels in a 3D display for creating volumetric light patterns.

project.title: Messa Di Voce
project.creator_name: Golan Levin, Zach Lieberman Joan La Barbara, Jaap Blonk
project.description: A performance and installation in which the speech, shouts and songs produced by two vocalists are augmented in real-time by custom interactive visualization

project.title: Manual Input Sessions
project.description: A series of audiovisual vignettes which probe the expressive possibilities of hand gestures and finger movements. Performed using a combination of custom software and overhead projectors.

project.title: Listening Post
project.description: Listening Post is a 'dynamic portrait' of online communication, displaying uncensored fragments of text sampled in real-time, from public internet chatrooms and bulletin boards.

project.title: The Transfiguration
project.description: An ever-changing organic costume using motion captured walk cycles in a parade of fantastical humanoid characters.

project.title: Open Paths
project.creator_name: Brian House, Jer Thorp, Jake Poroway
project.description: A model for personal engagement with data that lets people track their locations and visualize where they've been using a simple smartphone app.

project.title: Good Morning!
project.description: GoodMorning! is a Twitter visualization tool that shows about 11000 'good morning' tweets over a 24 hour period, rendering a sample of tweets around the globe.

project.title: Kepler Exoplanet Candidates
project.description: (2012)- A visualization of the 1236 exoplanet candidates observed by NASA's Kepler mission.

project.title: Cascade
project.creator_name: Jer Thorp, Mark Hansen, Jake Poroway
project.description: Cascade is a tool for analyzing sharing activity on the web, and displaying how information propagates through the social media space.

project.title: Transparency Grenade
project.description: A digital weapon for leaking information from closed meetings by pulling a pin. The device captures network traffic and audio in a location and anonymously streams it to an external server that mines it for information.

project.title: ToxicLibs
project.description: Toxiclibs is an independent, modular open source library collection for Java and Processing, widely used by artists for 3D visualization and interactive art.

project.title: Coronal Mass Ejection
project.description: Generative Coronal Mass Ejection, created for the Written Images project. It was developed in Cinder, a powerful C++ library for art, design and visual effects.

project.title: Solar Rework
project.description: Audio-responsive application created for the V&A Museum. Created with Processing.

project.title: Super Mario Clouds
project.description: An old Mario Brothers cartridge modified to erase everything but the clouds.

project.title: Social Turkers
project.description: A crowdsourced performance in which the artist streamed videos of herself on a series of dates for an online audience and paid them to tell her what to do, say or ask.

project.title: Calendars
project.description: The calendars were made for purely aesthetic reasons and represent no intent to advance the state of the art in digital time management. They were in fact, designed for you to waste time instead of save time. - 2005

project.title: Reactive Book
project.description: A compendium of four software studies exploring the relationship between the book and the computer as visual media - 1995

project.title: Reactive Squares
project.description: 10 squares that respond to input from the microphone. This sketch was the first in a series, later published within Maeda's Reactive Book - 1995

project.title: Design by Numbers
project.description: A minimal programming enviornment for artists and designers, created by John Maeda in the 1990s. Its simple, intuitive approach inspired Processing by Reas and Fry.=

project.title: Nature
project.description: A series of seven motion paintings inspired by natural phenomena.

project.title: Energy Flow
project.creator_name: Vera Glahn, Marcus Wendt - Field IO
project.description: A non-linear film exploreing complexity and interconnectivity. Ten animated story lines flow together in a dream of paintings in motion.

project.title: Thinking Machine
project.description: Play chess against an artificial intelligence program, and watch as the computer's thought process is sketched on screen as it plays. A map is created from the traces of literally thousands of possible futures as the program tries to decide its best move.

project.title: Transfinite
project.description: An audiovisual landscape exploring the concept of infinity and the beauty of data. Ikeda's first work in the united states, exhibited at NYC's Park Avenue Armory. -2011

project.title: Datamatics
project.description: A large-scale installation exploring the landscape of data that invisibly permeates our world - 2006

project.title: Cell Cycle
project.description: An interactive WEBGL design app that lets you create your own 3d-printed jewelry using a physics simulation to form unique cellular designs.

project.title: Hyphae
project.description: Hyphae is a collection of 3D printed artifacts constructed of rhizome-like networks, inspired by the vein structures that carry fluids through organisms from the leaves of plants to our own circulatory systems.

project.title: Funky Forest
project.description: An interactive ecosystem where children create trees with their body and divert water flowing from a waterfall keep the trees alive, contributing to the overall health of the forest.

project.title: Communion
project.creator_name: Matt Pyke, Vera Glahn, Marcus Wendt
project.description: An array of evolving creatures going through stages of development from simple cellular structures to dancing multi-limbed creatures.

project.title: Galapagos
project.description: Viewers help evolve 3D animated creatures by selecting which ones will be allowed to live and produce new, mutated offspring.

project.title: Evolved Virtual Creatures
project.description: A population of several hundred creatures is created within a supercomputer, and each creature is tested for their ability to perform a given task.

project.title: People Staring at Computers
project.description: A simple application to takes a picture every minute, finds faces, and uploads them to a server. Kyle installed it in public places, such as the Apple Store, to secretly gather portraits of people staring at computers.

project.title: Keytweeter
project.description: A one-year performance for custom keylogger, tweeting every 140 characters I type, ending June 30, 2010. An exploration of the boundary between "information" and "control", ubiquitous status updates, and personal identity.

project.title: Face OSC
project.description: FaceOSC is a tool for prototyping face-based interaction, released as an addon for openFrameworks. It applies facetracking algorithms by researcher Jason Saragih.

project.title: Face Subsitution
project.description: Real time face tracking and substitution experiments including a realization of the Scramble Suit and an interactive installation Faces that picks a new face for you every time you blink. - 2011

project.title: Sniff
project.description: A CG dog projected on a storefront follows the viewer and responds to his gestures, behaving according to the person's state of engagement.

project.title: Aesthetics and Computation Group
project.description: A lab at MIT that helped establish the field of computational art and design. Alumni include Golan Levin, Casey Reas, Ben Fry, Elise Co, Peter Cho, Jared Schiffman, Axel Kilian and Tom White.

project.title: قلب, (Alb)
project.description: A fully-functional programming language based on Arabic script.

project.title: Syn_
project.description: Kurokawa performs audiovisual compositions designed to overload the senses, combining aesthetics of nature and technology.

project.title: Partitura
project.description: A real-time music visualisation tool with 500 different visual parameters that uses algorithms to generate a palette of colors inspired by Kandinsky and Paul Klee. - 2011

project.title: Particle Dreams
project.description: A collection of dream sequences created using 3D particle systems techniques. - 1988
